entries.title: House to Vote to Strip IRS Funds Intended to Catch Tax Cheats
entries.description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, Dec. 21, 2022. US lawmakers have agreed to a $1.7 trillion funding bill and plan to ram the compromise legislation through the House and Senate this week to avert a Dec. 24 government shutdown. Photographer: Nathan Howard/Bloomberg

entries.title: DOJ Reviewing Classified Files Found at Former Biden Office
entries.description: An American flag flies outside the Department of Justice building in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Monday, June 21, 2021. The White House plan for trillions of dollars in proposed spending and tax increases is entering a procedural and political thicket in Congress that's likely to take at least until September to clear. Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg

entries.title: Virginia’s Youngkin Says Poor Planning Cost State Big Projects
entries.description: Virginia has lost out in recent months when major companies have opted to put manufacturing plants in other states, where the land is ready for construction and where the cost of living and doing business is lower, Republican Governor Glenn Youngkin said Monday in an editorial board meeting with Bloomberg News.

entries.title: Trump Ally Giuliani Gets Subpoena From Washington Grand Jury
entries.description: Rudy Giuliani, personal lawyer to U.S. President Donald Trump, listens as President Donald Trump speaks during a news conference in the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room at the White House in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Sunday, Sept. 27, 2020. Trump denied a report that he paid just $750 in federal income taxes in 2016 and 2017, and repeated his stance to only share his tax returns after an audit is finished.

entries.title: What Led Up to the Attack on Brazil’s Government?
entries.description: Thousands of supporters of Brazilian ex-President Jair Bolsonaro stormed congress, the presidential palace and the top court in Brasilia on Sunday, in what some saw as an attempt to trigger a military coup. Many Bolsonaro supporters have been pleading with the military to step in ever since President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva won a tightly contested runoff election on Oct. 30. It was the worst attack on Brazil’s key institutions since the end of a military dictatorship and return to democracy in

entries.title: UK Weighs Backdating Next NHS Pay Rise to Stop Wave of Strikes
entries.description: Demonstrators hold placards on a picket line during a strike by NHS nursing staff outside the Royal Liverpool University Hospital in Liverpool, UK, on Tuesday, Dec. 20, 2022. Nurses, ambulance drivers, the border force and postal, rail and bus workers are all set to walk out this week as they battle with employers amid the cost-of-living crisis.

entries.title: Virginia Governor Says ESG Transparency Has Gone Too Far
entries.description: Virginia Republican Governor Glenn Youngkin, the former co-chief executive officer of Carlyle Group, said the transparency demands around ‘ESG’ investing have gone too far in recent years.

entries.title: White House Rips McCarthy-GOP Deal as Path to ‘Defund’ Military
entries.description: The White House accused GOP lawmakers of seeking to “defund” the military, seizing on an agreement to elect Kevin McCarthy speaker of the House that may lead to defense spending cuts.

entries.title: Thai Election Jockeying Heats Up as PM Prayuth Joins New Party
entries.description: Prayuth Chan-Ocha

entries.title: Trump Urges Republicans to Use Debt Ceiling as Bargaining Chip
entries.description: Donald Trump told congressional Republicans to play “tough” on raising the federal debt limit later this year, stoking sentiment in the GOP for a potentially market-rattling showdown in order to pressure Democrats on spending cuts.

entries.title: Covid Rips Through Rural China Ahead of Lunar New Year Migration
entries.description: Volunteers disinfect Jianggou Village in Shandong province, in Nov 2022.

entries.title: Trump Ally Jason Smith to Lead Congress’s Powerful Tax Committee
entries.description: The appointment places a pro-Trump lawmaker in charge of the chamber’s tax, trade and health agenda

entries.title: Texas Projects Record $32.7 Billion Budget Surplus, Driven by Sales Tax
entries.description: Texas is forecasting a record $32.7 billion budget surplus as a surge in sales taxes boosts the government’s revenue by billions more than what analysts had estimated.

entries.title: Illinois Governor Wants to Ban Assault Weapons, Expand Childcare
entries.description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker is pushing to expand child care, make college more affordable and ban assault weapons as the billionaire Democrat begins his second term.

entries.title: Brazil Senator Asks Court to Order Bolsonaro’s Return from US
entries.description: Brazilian Senate President Renan Calheiros speaks during a session of the Senate in Brasilia on December 8, 2016. Brazil's Supreme Court Wednesday overruled a bid to suspend the powerful Senate speaker from his position as he faces trial for alleged embezzlement, offering some relief to the scandal-hit government. / AFP / EVARISTO SA (Photo credit should read EVARISTO SA/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Macron, Kishida Vow Closer Cooperation in Indo-Pacific Region
entries.description: Emmanuel Macron welcomes Fumio Kishida as he arrives for a meeting at the Elysee Palace in Paris on Jan. 9.

entries.title: McCarthy’s Rules of Order Become Latest Republican Battleground
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy

entries.title: Biden, Trudeau to Huddle on Haiti Mission US Is Reluctant to Lead
entries.description: President Joe Biden looks to Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau during a meeting of G7 and NATO leaders in Bali, Indonesia, Wednesday, Nov. 16, 2022. (Doug Mills/The New York Times via AP, Pool)

entries.title: Fed’s Bostic Favors Holding Rates Above 5% for ‘a Long Time’
entries.description: Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic said the central bank should raise interest rates above 5% by early in the second quarter and then go on hold for “a long time.”

entries.title: UK to Cut Energy Aid to Firms From April as Hunt Seeks Taxpayer Savings
entries.description: The UK government said it’s cutting energy support to businesses from April as Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt seeks savings to help shore up the public finances.

entries.title: Gaetz Earns Most-Hated Status in GOP Even as He Gains House Sway
entries.description: Representative Matt Gaetz is emerging from last week’s bitter speaker fight as the member of Congress everyone in Washington loves to hate.

entries.title: Debt-Cap Risks for Markets to Intensify If Stopgap Deals Are Used
entries.description: The US is expected to run up against its statutory borrowing cap later in the year, and the risk is that lawmakers may resort to a series of can-kicking measures that wind up roiling financial markets.

entries.title: Virginia Police Say 6-Year-Old Boy Shot Teacher During Class
entries.description: Newport News, Va. (AP) -- In the moments before a 6-year-old Virginia boy shot his teacher, there was no fight, no physical struggle and no warning, authorities said Monday.

entries.title: Bolsonaro Hospitalized in US After Brasilia Riots, O Globo Says
entries.description: BRASILIA, BRAZIL - NOVEMBER 01: President of Brazil Jair Bolsonaro looks on after a press conference two days after being defeated by Lula da Silva in the presidential runoff at Alvorada Palace on November 1, 2022 in Brasilia, Brazil. Bolsonaro didn't acknowledge his defeat and asked supporters to protest in a pacific way and allowing free transit through the country. (Photo by Andressa Anholete/Getty Images)

entries.title: Taiwan-Invasion War Game by US Think Tank Sees China Quickly Flopping
entries.description: Soldiers participate in a military exercise in Miaoli, Taiwan, in July 2022.

entries.title: Trump Deposition in Rape Accuser’s Lawsuit Ordered Unsealed
entries.description: Parts of a deposition former President Donald Trump gave in a lawsuit by a woman who claims he raped her in the 1990s were ordered unsealed by a federal judge.

entries.title: US Sets Early 2024 Deadline for 5G Signal Safeguards on Aircraft
entries.description: A contractor installs 5G cellular equipment on a light pole as a Delta Air Lines, Inc. Airbus A320 airplane lands at Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) in Inglewood, California on January 19, 2022. - Telecom giants AT&T and Verizon began 5G cell phone data service in the United States Wednesday without major disruptions to flights after the launch of the new wireless technology was scaled back. (Photo by Patrick T. FALLON / AFP) (Photo by PATRICK T. FALLON/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Brazil Football Condemns Rioters Storming Capital in Iconic Jersey
entries.description: Brazil’s football association condemned the widespread use of its iconic yellow jersey by supporters of former President Jair Bolsonaro in the insurrection that took the country’s capital by storm on Sunday.

entries.title: Gender Pay Equity Progress in US Is Slowed by Family Leave, Study Says
entries.description: Family leave policies, though limited in scope and typically unpaid in the US, have hamstrung the progress toward gender wage parity since the 1990s, according to an economic paper.

entries.title: US Hasn’t Received Bolsonaro Extradition Request, Sullivan Says
entries.description: The Biden administration hasn’t received any requests from Brazil to extradite former President Jair Bolsonaro, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said.

entries.title: Traffic Deaths in the US Trending Downward Even as Driving Increases
entries.description: Traffic fatalities on US roads declined slightly in the third quarter of 2022, marking the second straight drop in road deaths after rising for nearly two years.

entries.title: Lula Asserts Authority in Brazil as 1,500 Bolsonaro Supporters Are Held
entries.description: TOPSHOT - Security forces arrest supporters of Brazilian former President Jair Bolsonaro who invaded Planalto Presidential Palace in Brasilia on January 8, 2023. - Hundreds of supporters of Brazil's far-right ex-president Jair Bolsonaro broke through police barricades and stormed into Congress, the presidential palace and the Supreme Court Sunday, in a dramatic protest against President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva's inauguration last week. (Photo by Ton MOLINA / AFP) (Photo by TON MOLINA/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Small Gain in Russian Oil Sales Can't Reverse Grinding Downtrend
entries.description: Combined flows to China, India, Turkey hit lowest since October

entries.title: Georgia Grand Jury Investigating Trump Submits Recommendations, Disbands
entries.description: The special grand jury investigating former President Donald Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election results in Georgia has finished its work and is being disbanded, according to a court order issued Monday.

entries.title: Social Media Firms Failed Once Again in Brazil
entries.description: Insurrection in Brasilia shows the damage that can be done when Meta, TikTok and other platforms neglect viral misinformation in foreign markets.

entries.title: Santos Illegally Hid Source of Campaign Donations, Group Alleges
entries.description: Republican Representative George Santos illegally hid the source of donations to his campaign and violated other provisions of campaign finance law, according to a new complaint filed to the Federal Election Commission.

entries.title: Estonia to Move Ahead of EU With Plans to Seize Russian Assets
entries.description: Estonia plans to introduce a legal blueprint for seizing Russian assets this month as the Baltic nation moves ahead with a bid to deliver funds frozen under European Union sanctions to Ukraine.

entries.title: Brazil’s Real Leads Global Losses After Rioters Storm Capital
entries.description: Real, Brazilian stocks trail global peers amid political concerns after Sunday’s insurrection

entries.title: Supreme Court Rejects Fannie-Freddie Investors on US Profit-Taking
entries.description: The US Supreme Court turned away four appeals from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac shareholders who said they were entitled to compensation after the Treasury collected more than $100 billion in profits from the government-sponsored enterprises.

entries.title: South African President Plays Down Central Bank Mandate Change Talk
entries.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa played down suggestions that an amendment to the central bank’s mandate is imminent, while confirming that a possible change remains under discussion.

entries.title: Ex-CEO of McDonald’s to Pay SEC Fine Over Misrepresenting Exit
entries.description: Former McDonald’s Corp. Chief Executive Officer Stephen Easterbrook agreed to pay $400,000 over allegations from US regulators that he failed to disclose “improper relationships” with employees at the company.

entries.title: UK, EU Make Brexit Talks Breakthrough on Trade Database Sharing
entries.description: The European Union is poised to agree to use the UK’s live database tracking goods moving from Great Britain to Northern Ireland, the first sign of progress in a long-running dispute on post-Brexit trading rules.

entries.title: Germany’s Finance Minister Faces Pressure Over Real Estate Loan
entries.description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner is facing pressure over a real estate loan after reports emerged that he had provided a video greeting for the bank that issued it.

entries.title: UK Is Considering Sending Battle Tanks to Ukraine, Officials Say
entries.description: The UK is considering sending Challenger 2 battle tanks to Ukraine, according to two people familiar with the discussions, underscoring the intensifying efforts of Kyiv’s allies to provide it with heavier offensive weapons.

entries.title: Egypt Tightens Spending on Costly Projects Amid Currency Crunch
entries.description: Egypt passed new rules aimed at curbing state spending, including halting costly new projects, as the North African nation struggles with its worst foreign-currency squeeze in years.

entries.title: Sweden Starts Talks With US on Defense Cooperation Agreement
entries.description: Sweden and the US have started negotiations on a defense cooperation agreement as the Nordic nation prepares to become a fully fledged member of NATO along with its neighbor Finland.

entries.title: Israel Orders Crackdown on Palestinian Flags as Tensions Simmer
entries.description: A top official in Benjamin Netanyahu’s new right-wing government said he had ordered Israeli police to crack down on the public display of Palestinian flags, days after he stirred tensions by visiting a holy site in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Thai Premier Joins New Party to Retain Power After Next Election
entries.description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-Ocha formally joined a new political party on Monday as the former coup-leader seeks to retain the job after general elections expected within months.

entries.title: Plans for Voter ID Under Fire as UK Electoral Commission Launches Campaign
entries.description: Plans to force voters to show identification at polling stations have come under renewed criticism after it emerged a public awareness campaign could cost more than £5.6 million.

entries.title: Controversial China Diplomat Zhao Shifted From High-Profile Role
entries.description: China has transferred a senior diplomat closely associated with the Foreign Ministry’s more confrontational shift in recent years to a new role, in the latest sign that Beijing is rethinking its so-called “Wolf Warrior” approach.

entries.title: Thousands of New York City Nurses Go on Strike at Two Hospitals
entries.description: More than 7,000 nurses at two major New York City hospitals went on strike Monday, saying staffing levels at private-sector facilities are inadequate and that pay should be higher.

entries.title: Meta Oversight Board Okays Posts Saying ‘Death to’ Iran’s Leader
entries.description: Meta Platforms Inc.’s Oversight Board has overturned the decision to remove a Facebook post using the slogan “death to Khamenei,” to criticize Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, saying it did not violate a rule barring violent threats.

entries.title: Prince Harry Accuses Royals of Complicity in Meghan’s Pain
entries.description: London (AP) -- Prince Harry has accused the royal family of being complicit in his wife Meghan’s anguish, claiming his stepmother Camilla, the queen consort, had leaked private conversations to the media in order to burnish her own reputation.

entries.title: What Brazil’s Own Capitol Riot Means for Lula
entries.description: The precedent was hard to ignore as key government institutions in Brazil were stormed by supporters of former President Jair Bolsonaro who ran amok in downtown Brasilia.

entries.title: Gasoline Prices Are Set to Rise If Corn-Belt States Win Fuel Fight
entries.description: Some Americans could end up paying more for their gasoline thanks to a plan by seven Midwestern state governors to boost the use of corn-based ethanol.

entries.title: Biden, AMLO, Trudeau Aim to Ease Tension Over Trade and Migrants
entries.description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador will welcome US President Joe Biden and Canadian President Justin Trudeau to Mexico City on Monday for a summit aimed in part at easing tensions over migration and drug smuggling.

entries.title: McCarthy Confronts Next Test After Bruising House Speaker Fight
entries.description: Newly elected House Speaker Kevin McCarthy confronts an immediate test to his leadership after a bruising four-day fight with Republican rebels in which he finally won the gavel but at great political cost.

entries.title: Ramaphosa Says Eskom CEO Quit Because ‘It’s a Tough Job’
entries.description: The chief executive officer of Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd., Andre de Ruyter, resigned because “its a tough job,” South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said, stressing that the government has a “cohesive” plan to resolve the national power shortage.

entries.title: South Africa to Use BRICS Chair Role to Advance Africa Interests
entries.description: South Africa will use its role as the 2023 chair of the BRICS grouping of nations to advance the interest of Africa as a whole, President Cyril Ramaphosa said.

entries.title: Turkey Official Overseeing GDP Data Removed by Statistics Agency
entries.description: Turkey’s state statistics agency removed a senior official overseeing the calculation of a key measure of output after worse-than-expected economic data, according to people familiar with the matter, heightening concerns over the independence of the institution.

entries.title: America’s Aggressive Chip Strategy Forces China Into a Corner
entries.description: Beijing is looking for a strategy to overcome US moves to stymie its semiconductor industry.

entries.title: Palestinian Prime Minister Says Israel Aims to Topple the PA
entries.description: Tel Aviv, Israel (AP) -- The Palestinian prime minister on Monday accused Israel’s new ultra-nationalist government of trying to topple the internationally recognized Palestinian Authority, and warned that a series of new Israeli sanctions could further inflame what has been a particularly deadly period of fighting.

entries.title: Sweden Aims to Reactivate Civil Conscription to Boost Defense
entries.description: Sweden’s government is taking steps to reactivate civil conscription in the latest move to shore up its defense capabilities in the wake of Russia’s war against Ukraine.

entries.title: What China’s Lunar New Year Treks Mean for Covid Surge: QuickTake
entries.description: For the first time since the outbreak of the pandemic, people in China can travel freely for Lunar New Year, the country’s most important holiday. The annual ritual of family reunion usually involves billions of trips, but those were sharply curtailed over the past three years as the government urged people to “celebrate where you are” to avoid spreading Covid-19. The abrupt lifting of the country’s strict Covid Zero policy at the end of 2022 has already led to a huge wave of new infections. The

entries.title: China Considering Record Local Debt Quota, Wider Budget Deficit
entries.description: Chinese officials are considering a record quota for special local government bonds this year and widening the budget deficit target as they ramp up support for the world’s second-largest economy, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Czech Ex-Premier Acquitted in Fraud Case Before Presidential Run
entries.description: Former Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis was acquitted in a fraud case concerning European Union money, bolstering his bid at a political comeback in this month’s presidential election.

entries.title: Falling US Satellite Sparks Emergency Phone Alert in South Korea
entries.description: South Koreans, used to getting mobile phone alerts warning of earthquakes or Covid outbreaks, received a more unusual notification Monday morning, cautioning of danger from above.

entries.title: Marcos Names New Defense Chief as Military Quells Talk of Unrest
entries.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has named former vaccine czar and peace adviser Carlito Galvez Jr. as defense chief after the department’s top official resigned as the military stamped out talk of unrest among troops.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Reinforcements to Be Sent to Front-Line Towns
entries.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Ukraine is sending reinforcements to defend two front-line towns in the Donetsk region that he said have seen among the bloodiest fighting since Russia’s invasion.

entries.title: Thailand Scraps Vaccine Proof Requirement for Foreign Visitors in U-Turn
entries.description: Thailand withdrew a rule requiring foreign travelers to carry proof of Covid vaccination on Monday, just days after reinstating the barrier ahead of the arrival of Chinese tourists.

entries.title: Hong Kong Scraps Contact Tracing App That Raised Privacy Concern
entries.description: Hong Kong is discarding its Covid contact tracing app, one of the most visible components of its pandemic infrastructure.

entries.title: Path to China Chips Ban Goes Through Korea, Says US Envoy
entries.description: The US is in discussions with Japan, the Netherlands and South Korea to restrict semiconductor exports to China, and it needs all parties to agree on a deal, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel said in an interview.

entries.title: China Says Pivot Away From Covid Zero Predated Mass Protests
entries.description: China said it started making major changes to Covid Zero even before nationwide protests widely credited with prompting the shift, as Beijing sought to counter the narrative that President Xi Jinping was forced to abandon a signature policy.

entries.title: All the Best Quotes From Prince Harry's First Two TV Interviews on New Memoir
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex has given the first two of four television interviews about his controversial autobiography Spare.

entries.title: Brazil Justice Orders Federal District Governor Removed From Job
entries.description: A Brazilian top court justice ordered Federal District Governor Ibaneis Rocha removed from office for 90 days while his responsibility in the unrest that took place in the nation’s capital is investigated.

entries.title: Jokowi Flags Cabinet Changes as Indonesia Coalition Ties Sour
entries.description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo has confirmed plans for another cabinet change amid fraying ties between two major parties in the ruling coalition ahead of the presidential elections next year.

entries.title: Bolsonaro Issues Muted Condemnation of Riots at Brazil’s Capital
entries.description: Former Brazilian president and conservative firebrand Jair Bolsonaro spoke out against supporters who invaded and vandalized the government’s top institutions on Sunday.

entries.title: In Pictures: Brazil in Chaos as Protesters Storm Government Buildings
entries.description: Thousands of supporters of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro stormed Brazil’s top seats of power Sunday, in an insurrection that drew comparisons with the US Capitol attack of Jan. 6, 2021.

entries.title: Ministers Hold Series of Talks With Union Bosses in Bid to Avert Strikes
entries.description: Ministers will hold a series of meetings with union leaders as they seek to prevent future strikes over pay in the NHS, in class rooms and on the rails.

entries.title: Sunak Heads for Crunch Talks With Unions as Strikes Hobble UK
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is set for talks with the union leaders directing the wave of strikes that have hobbled the UK since the start of the year, as the threat of more widespread action hangs over the country.
